page.title: 03THE SOUTH-EAST VIEW.
page.content: The south-east view from the highest point,is largely urbanised.In the distance one can see the outskirts of Bradford and in the foreground the town of Keighley.In the valley bottom is the industrial area of Keighley and on the slopes above are the residential areas including the Fell Lane Estate,Riddlesden,Braithwaite, Ingrow and the Shann Park Estate. Looking S.W. one can see in the distance the Haworth Moors including Penistone Hill at 1030ft.These moors are said to have been used by the Bronte Sisters for the backgrounds to their novels. A sand quarry can be clearly seen on the hillside above Keighley.One can also see Goose Eye,a quaint village, in the valley bottom,famous locally for the Turkey Inn.
